comment.author: 79367498@N04
comment._content: A beautiful 1936 Ryan ST-A Serial # 114, NC 14982. Shown here being righted after an unfortunate nose over. This plane was originally used for student training at the Ryan School.  It is also the exact plane displayed suspended from the ceiling at the Pacific Aircraft Show in L.A. in February 1936.  Later was owned by Olen V. Andrew of the Andrew Flying Service in Honolulu and was believed to be in the air at the time of the Japanese attack on Pearl Harbor.
